sub_title: Doctoral Candidate at Faculty of Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (ITC) of the University of Twente
summary:
A spatial and regional planning expert with over a decade of experience in consultancy services involving various town, urban and regional development planning and management projects. Expertise in different inclusive planning process approaches for spatial/non-spatial development plans, policies and strategies across Nigeria birthed my research interest in providing practical solutions with the use of planning support systems (PSS) in the spatial planning practices across the Global South. 

A researcher with consultancy experience avails practical knowledge to execute studies to embed and institutionalise PSS in spatial planning practice. My interest in PSS encompasses the use of geo-information sciences (GIS) tools, technologies and methodologies. Also,  the quest for contemporary innovations and methods in spatial planning strategies for a sustainable, inclusive and resilient environment for human settlement, socio-economic development and regional planning. 

One of such innovation I work with and research is the Spatial Development Framework (SDF) methodology developed by UN-HABITAT in 2011 which is being implemented in countries across the global south. https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/13563475.2019.1658571

profile_positions.company: Faculty of Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (ITC) of the University of Twente
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Coordinate administrative and operational activities for the organisation. Team lead on urban development planning and management projects such as baseline studies, research, development plans, planning advocacies, impact assessments, transport studies, planning policies/strategies, plan implementation frameworks, socio-economic development and project sustainability analyses, etc.
profile_positions.title: Principal Partner

profile_positions.description: Embedding Planning Support Systems (PSS) in spatial planning process: The case of Spatial Development Framework (SDF) methods in Rwanda.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Member of the Project Management Team that ensures a seamless connection between the Project Management Team and the Project Technical Team. As the project coordinator, I maintained project schedules and milestones by ensuring every deadline was met. Relates to all Project Technical Team to ensure all tasks were understood and completed. 
Documented project's progress reports, arrange and coordinates project meetings. Reviewed and edited all submissions (reports, proposals, maps, etc.) to the project management team and client. Coordinated various field studies and surveys (baseline studies, land use mapping, socio-economic studies, transportation studies,  infrastructure audits, heritage sites, mapping, market surveys, etc.)
profile_positions.title: Project Officer, Ikorodu Sub-Region Master Plan

profile_positions.description:
Coordination of project activities for the organisation. Organise project meeting and stakeholder consultation programmes. Preparation of technical and financial proposals and contract negotiations with clients. Liaising with relevant Ministries, Departments and Agencies (MDAs) for physical development purposes and procurement of planning approvals.

Acquired additional capacity development and negotiation skills for top-level management relationship/project management.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Officer

profile_positions.description:
Managed activities of my employer as the Managing Partner, and as the National President, Association of Town Planning Consultants of Nigeria (2013 - 2015). This includes planning and scheduling of meetings/appointments, travelling logistics managing correspondences, preparation of memoranda, letters/speeches and other responsibilities as scheduled for a Project Officer. Managed the Company’s email accounts and correspondences.

Acquired skills in the coordination of managerial and administrative duties, representative roles, time management and coordination of multiple tasks in addition to efficient delivery of schedules with similar deadlines.
profile_positions.title: Special Assistant to Managing Partner

profile_positions.description:
Preparation of physical development plans, specialised plans such as the Campus plan, Forensic Laboratory Master Plan, Free Trade Zone Master Plan, etc. Review of master plans and urban regeneration/redevelopment plans. Preparation of physical planning technical reports, traffic impact assessment/analysis report, and planning advocacy reports. Liaising with relevant Ministries, Departments and Agencies (MDAs) for physical development purposes and procurement of planning approvals. Coordinate field surveys/studies, community awareness and mobilisation programmes and consultation forum. Coordinate and mentor student trainee/interns.
Achievements include participation in special projects such as the Lagos State Forensic Science Centre Master Plan, Badagry, Federal University Oye-Ekiti Master Plan, Ekiti State, Ondo State Free Trade Zone Master Plan, Ugbo, Orile-Owu Physical Development Plan, Osun State etc. Also, mentoring of younger professionals and student trainees.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer I

profile_positions.description:
Preparation of physical development/layout plans, physical planning technical reports and traffic impact assessment reports. Liaising with Ministries, Departments and Agencies (MDAs) in charge of physical development approvals for procurement of planning approvals for clients. Coordinate field surveys/studies and administered questionnaires used for physical development plan assessments and reports. Digitize survey plans and maps used for design purposes. Participate in community sensitisation, public awareness and motivation programs for projects. Coordinate and mentor student trainee/interns.
Achievements include elected as a full member, Nigerian Institue of Town Planners (2010), certification as a Registered Town Planner by the Town Planners Registration Council of Nigeria (TOPREC) in 2011. I also acquired basic practical skills needed for professional practice, preparation of questionnaire for various projects, teamwork, mentoring, networking and become skilled at the use of AutoCAD software for designs. Participated in the preparation of the State of the Environment Report – Lagos, 2010 and Lagos State Adaptation Project – Cluster B, 2011 (under the Building Nigeria’s Response to Climate Change (BNRCC)) which focused on six major components (energy, transportation, industry and commerce, financial services, human settlement and health, disaster management) both supervised by Ministry of the Environment, Lagos State.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer II

profile_positions.description:
Marketing of the Lagos Housing Fair Exhibition, a yearly six-days housing professionals, products and services event usually held on every first week of May. I was also in charge of space allocation to exhibitors and a tour guide to various participants and partners during the event. 
I acquired skills in event organisation and management. Sealed various sponsorship deals from organisations and advert placement in the event brochure.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Executive, 10th Lagos Housing Fair
